ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My understanding of French grammar improved, and I think that my speaking ability improved too. It was also rewarding to engage with more complicated texts.

I learned a lot about the immigrant experience classism in France. I also leaned about friendship and the experiences of francophone people who live in the diaspora from the texts we read. Personally, I learned that a lot of time needs to be dedicated to doing well in a language class.
I felt that the level of my French increased dramatically with this course and I also got a good look into certain aspects of French culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I kind of wish there was a better way of making sure everyone was involved in our class discussions, it never felt like I could speak in class. The texts were less islamophobic in this course which is a win for the French department!

I thought that the readings for this course were very engaging and well-selected. I appreciated the discussion format of the class which was very conducive to improving my oral skills. I really enjoyed this course, the community that was built among my classmates after a semester of engaging discussions, and the closeness I felt with Prof Schneider.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would, I think it is a really great opportunity to further round out your understanding of French after L4.
Its not easy, but its definitely necessary for French grammar.
Yes! Great if you want to learn French.
I would absolutely recommend this course to other students for an intellectual challenge, a way to improve one's French skills, and a place to enjoy interesting discussions with other students.
